reviews.review_msg: He's a nice enough guy but knows nothing about how to run a class as an instructor. He talked a bit too much and went off topic a lot. He leaves no feedback. The worst part about his courses is that you have absolutely NO idea what grade you are standing at until the end of the semester, which by then is pretty much too late to make a difference.
If you are registered get out of the class...NOW! Chunn sits there and reads off her fully highlighted paper for the first part of the 3 hour seminar. Bring a pillow you will fall asleep!

can't lecture!  when she speaks she jumps from topic to topic seamlessly, you don't know when one point ends and another begins.  Her paper topics are ambiguous at best, and she relies on videos to teach rather than attempting herself.
She is quiet, and her lectures are dry. I agree with the other commentors. Bring coffee. The class material is excellent, I wish it had a good teacher to boot.
Avoid any class she teaches like the plague. Unclear, does not answer questions. Talks at you and generates NO class discussion!

dorothy is a great prof...readings are interesting and class discussions are generated often.  She's a tough marker, but more than fair about it, and while her lectures may be dry at times, they are necessary to any complete understanding of the topic.

An apparently interesting topic (Crime, Media, Public) is relegated to utter boredom as she ambles on and on with no apparent passion. Not inspiring whatsoever. I feel sick Wednesday mornings knowing I have to endure 3 hours of this class.
she is very quiet and a passive teacher
I get the feeling that people who use this site are pissed off at their profs...well Dorothy is awesome, if anybody asks
Boring lecturer - thought this class would be fun.  She proved me wrong.  Fairly hard marker as well.  Lecture will not inspire you to want to learn or work.
Pretty dry lecturer...especially on Wednesday Mornings!

Loves what she teaches and tries to make it as interesting as possible. Very organized and comprehensive lectures/notes. Marks very fairly. Term paper is kind of a killer (20-25 pages) but no exams. Overall, she's a lovely person and a very good prof.
